issues.description: The problem statement (UML) and task text specify addGuestStudents(int) as a void operation (it only describes adding guest students and the UML shows a void return type). The solution implementation defines public boolean addGuestStudents(int) that returns a boolean indicating success. This is a return-type/signature mismatch: students following the UML/text will implement a void method, while the solution uses a boolean return value. This can confuse students about the intended API and may break automated tests or comparisons that expect the void signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's method signature match the specification in the problem statement/UML. Change the solution implementation to: public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) { if (numberOfNewGuestStudents >= 0) { this.numberOfGuestStudents += numberOfNewGuestStudents; } } — or, if the boolean return is intentional, update the problem statement and UML to show addGuestStudents(int): boolean and document the meaning of the return value. Ensure template, problem text, UML and solution all use the same signature.
